title: Microscopy Analysis of the g-C3N4/Co3O4 Heterojunction for Environmental Applications
content: The accelerated growth of the world population and the consequent demand for a greater load of productive and industrial activity have meant that today there is a serious pollution problem in different ecosystems. One of the most urgent problems is the contamination of water bodies in the world due to the discharge of industrial waste. Among the contaminants in wastewater are heavy metals and organic molecules such as hexavalent chromium Cr (VI) and organic dyes, coming from the effluents of the electroplating and textile industries, respectively. Among the different alternatives proposed to eliminate contaminants in water, the photocatalytic process has been one of the most striking. In this process, it is carried out through the UV or visible photogeneration of electron-hole pairs in a semiconductor material (photocatalyst), promoting the redox reactions necessary to degrade or modify these contaminants [1, 2].
